geeklist.title: '22 Dice Tower West Virtual Flea Market
geeklist.description:
[b][center]DTW kicks off March 2nd, but why wait to spend money until then? On the flip side, maybe you'll sell a few items ahead of time so you can buy more stuff when you get there![/b] [IMG]https://static.wixstatic.com/media/41d157_53fc1511dcec4a6b98175ae3a6eb0e37~mv2_d_1372_1474_s_2.gif[/IMG][/center]
[b]What's this list for?[/b]
If you have items you'd like to sell at Dice Tower West, you can list them here. This is not part of the actual flea market that is happening at the con. This is just a forum to work out deals in advance of the con, so you can pack/plan accordingly.
[b]***Scheduled meet-up Friday 10 AM, in Area 3/4, next to the exhibitors in the main hall.***[/b]
Not everyone will be able to make this. It's recommended that you exchange contact info and touch base with your trade partner(s) before the con.
********************************************************************************
Guidelines
When you list your item, include the condition of the game and the price you'd like to sell it for. It's up to you to decide how you want the item to be sold (e.g. Fixed price, auction, best offer, etc). The transaction will be handled by you from beginning to end. Don't get offended by offers, this is a format where haggling is accepted, if not expected.
Please be aware, not everyone attends the entire convention. If this is you, it's helpful to list when you will/won't be there to avoid missing your buyer/seller.
Don't be a jerk! By agreeing to buy/sell a game, your partner is counting on you to keep your word. They are losing the chance to buy/sell with another person. Please only agree if you plan on honoring your word, and if life happens, send them a direct message asap. Also, there is no need to publicly questions prices. The market will dictate the value, it's not up to you to police it:cool:
Per BGG Guidelines, it is the seller's responsibility to process final sales through the BGG Marketplace.
It's best not to delete sold listings. This is your proof of the agreed price and condition. Just mark them as "sold" or change the photo to one that says "sold".
Be careful of double listing 1 game. If you plan on listing a game both here and the math trade, make sure you don't commit it to 2 people. Remove it from the math trade as soon as you have a deal here, or hold off on listing it until after the trade.
********************************************************************************
Most transactions will be handled at the con (ie: exchange cash for the game). You are expected to process your transactions in the Marketplace to pay BGG their 3% commission on all sales assisted by this site. The 3% is automatically added to Geek Marketplace transactions.
There are a couple of ways you can capture the items you have sold on the list:
1. List out each transaction in the marketplace. It does take some time, but it also builds your seller credentials on the Geek. There is a quick link to do this under each of your listings. Then, send your buyer the link for the listing.
2. You can also create a marketplace dummy sale item something like "Miscellaneous - DTW22 VFM Commission" as the item type/description and price it at whatever ends up being your total for sales, then "buy" it yourself. This will generate a seller's invoice via geek mail for the 3% commission payable by PayPal.
******************************************************************************** [i] If someone would be interested in compiling a master list from the geeklist for easy reference, please send me a GM.[/i]
You can post games you're wanting to buy here: [geeklist=293863][/geeklist]

[q="lyndathompson1"]Newbie here... just wondering if there is a way/button to sort games by name throughout this entire list? There are SO many pages... I'd love to sort by name on more than one page at a time. Saw the post on how to just have the listing without pictures, but there are still a lot of pages there, and not sure how to sort the names. If not, I totally understand. Thanks![/q] Previously other users had created a Master List for this purpose and Ben was able to add it to the original post. I wouldn't even know where to start with that and I am sure there is a lot of work to do to create one. I just consider it a nice bonus if it pops up at some point. Best bet is to try to keep pace with the list and subscribe to every new item that interests you.

Hey, Everyone! Quick question about GeekMarket Checkout for buyers... when I have made a "Quick Marketplace Listing" for the games I am selling, it puts it in the Geek Market. However, then when the buyer goes to the listing to complete the purchase, the Checkout Cart gives a message:
"Your cart contains Convention Preorder products that must be purchased on the Convention Preview page.
Follow this link to complete your purchase:"
But there is no link to follow. So the purchase cannot be completed. Could you help me with this? Is there another setting I should be using on the listing? I am wondering if I need to change the "Will deliver for pick up to the following event:" setting (which then does not have a drop-down selection for the Dice Tower West) somehow?
All advice appreciated! Thanks a Bunch! - Lynda

I'm not exactly sure what you are doing but I will run through my process. First, I don't generate these sales until the week of the con or even when I make the exchange with the buyer. Reason being is something could always happen (con canceled, buyer backs out, you get sick, etc) yet you are on "the hook" for the 3% owed to BGG. So that is #1
#2 Just create a sale on the Geek Market. You can use the Quick button under the item or just create one on your own. The quick option populates the notes section which is helpful but you can always write out your own disclaimer. The dropdown doesn't work in the Quick listing option for whatever reason. Just click the button that you noted it will be fine.
#3 Don't expect everyone to follow through on this. I do my due diligence but don't beat yourself up if you never receive a response from the buyer. I like to give BGG their portion and not getting the trade rating is kind of a bummer but it is what it is. Just follow #2 on the thee original posting if that occurs.

Thanks so much for clarifying, Brian! I will go with the "Cash On Delivery" option only then. Yes, bummer on the no ratings, but ultimately just want folks to enjoy the games. Looking forward to gaming with Everyone soon! - Lynda

I recommend making a sign with your username. I have one that has my avatar, username, and name. Don't forget, most people know you by your username, so that's who they'll be looking for.[/q]
In addition to user name and name, I also have the QR code to my venmo account. Makes it a little easier. That being said, anyone know how good the reception is in the hall or if wifi is available?

I'm not going to go through all of my listings and ping all the subscribers numerous times. I'll announce here that I am leaving early Monday morning, so if you want any of the games I've listed, you'll need to geekmail me your offer (which will need to be pretty close to what I've listed my items at). Otherwise, see you all at the con!

[b]Seriously people, don't delete your items. If they are no longer available just do a strikethrough. A lot of us track our items by item number and if you delete your item you throw things off for everyone. Please don't be an idiot.[/b]

I too found the renumbering caused by deletions to be annoying. I got around this by copying the item numbers I cared about into a spreadsheet. The numbers are a link to the ITEM. So, any renumbering became irrelevant.
Yeah i save a hard link to the item, so even if items get deleted, the link still takes you to the item.
Good idea. I'll have to do that for next year.

I wouldn’t call people idiots. I know it asks that items not be deleted but people may not read it all the way through or understand why that point is being made. It does make it more difficult to track which is why I just subscribe to all my listings individually. Then I can just run through them in my subscriptions. I do like the link in my spreadsheet idea though. Keeps it all in one place and even more organized. I’ll do that next year.

I used the spreadsheet approach by adding different sheets to track things I bought, sold, and traded. Here's a template: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wOi92PAKgA2qYJ3qhTJvvbtOBbt7R-OF8mVRee6Qk7A/edit?usp=sharing Some folks might prefer to have it printed, but I kept it in the digital format since I can easily access it and update it on my phone at the convention.

[q="marlnobor"]I used the spreadsheet approach by adding different sheets to track things I bought, sold, and traded. Here's a template: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wOi92PAKgA2qYJ3qhTJvvbtOBbt7R-OF8mVRee6Qk7A/edit?usp=sharing Some folks might prefer to have it printed, but I kept it in the digital format since I can easily access it and update it on my phone at the convention.[/q] Our spreadsheets are near identical. I even have my little notes section at the end. Next year I will have a link column to take me immediately to the listing and add a "Watching" tab as well for things I'm interested in. Then I can stay out of my subscriptions entirely.
Anyone have Wizard Lizard or Carcassone, please PM me :)
Would be interested in a copy of Pirate's Cove if anyone's got one to sell/trade.
I'm not getting any notifications when I subscribe to this thread and items I put up. Anyone have any idea what I'm doing wrong?

[q="nos1"]I'm not getting any notifications when I subscribe to this thread and items I put up. Anyone have any idea what I'm doing wrong?[/q] Have you checked your preferences in subscriptions? Make sure you didn't alter them before to not include replies or allow geeklists or anything like that. Otherwise if you are sure the subscribe button on the thread is clicked, you should be receiving notifications for every single post/reply. And if you do that, you wont receive any extra notifications for individual items that you ar specifically interested in following.
Is that something in my setup or for this thread only?

[q="nos1"]Is that something in my setup or for this thread only?[/q] It can be both but more likely its in your general preferences. You can easily get to it by clicking on the arrow next to subscribe at the top of this page and then go to edit preferences. That will be for this geeklist specifically but you can then just hit preferences from there to see your general selections.
ok a bunch of them had no on checked off. Thanks for the help. hope it works now.
ah man, I just found this list. Any reason there's no link to it on the Dice Tower west website?
It was in several DTW updates its 2700 items now but some good stuff lol. This will be open prob up until con so have fun.
yup, better start looking through it all.
I see some very nice items listed on page 63 & 64. Might be mine :D

I cant say that Mark Doesn't have nice things :cool: kinda got a few. But all the stuff I have in my trade list is also up for sale. See you guys at the Con. 2 Days away sweet. They have posted the map of the convention center now i think its about time to come up with a meeting location.

[-]2nd Edition KS with lots of extras and organization. Custom boss miniatures, tuckboxes for cards (some cards are sleeved, with extra sleeves), accordion folder for all map tiles, plano boxes for all chits and tokens, extra player cards custom printed (to allow for more players), 2 of 6 characters painted (the others are primed), metal dragon HP counter for bosses, extra D10 and D20 dice (gold and red) as HP Counters for enemies, includes all Solo Scenarios, card pockets for market cards. None of the stickers are used. Also included is Gloomhaven Jaws of the Lion.
Pictures linked ([b]avoid very last picture for boss minis[/b]): https://imgur.com/a/fOHiqmb $120[/-]

item.comment:
Do you by any chance make the rings for the landmark tokens as well?
See here for what I'm talking about:
https://www.etsy.com/listing/762382495/tapestry-expansions-board-game-deluxe
No, I don't make those. I never used the tokens - I just put the buildings on the board next to their spots (which takes no time with my bases on, because everything is color coded).

item.objectname: Western Legends: Wooden Trading Post & General Store
item.body: [b]Condition: [/b]New [b]Price: [/b][-]$15 $10[/-] $5
item.comment: Is this the version that came with the Ante Up campaign or Blood Money? I’m curious if it has the compatibility with the playmat which has a horseshoe for the General Store.

[q="colcakes196"]Is this the version that came with the Ante Up campaign or Blood Money? I’m curious if it has the compatibility with the playmat which has a horseshoe for the General Store.[/q]
Good question. This is from the Ante Up campaign. I'm not sure what you mean by the horseshoe.

The playmat came with a horseshoe symbol on it for both general stores, and kept the barrel for the trading post. The Blood Money version of the wooden general store has the front piece double sided with a barrel on one side, and a horseshoe on the other. So you could flip it depending on if you were playing with the boards or the playmat.

item.body:
[ImageID=6547472] [b]Edition: [/b] Korean Black Edition [b]Condition: [/b] NIS [b]$35[/b]
[b]Sold to Nightmaren[/b]
Rare edition only found in Korea. Has best artwork for Tichu hands down (based on uplay edition). Comes with 2 sets of deck. Give one deck to your friend or combine them to play 12 player tichu! Only comes with Korean rule, but English rule can be easily found online.

[ImageID=6547470] [b]Edition: [/b] Korean Red Edition [b]Condition: [/b] NIS [b]$35[/b]
[b]Sold to Nightmaren[/b]
Rare edition only found in Korea. Has best artwork for Tichu hands down (based on uplay edition). Comes with 2 sets of deck. Give one deck to your friend or combine them to play 12 player tichu! Only comes with Korean rule, but English rule can be easily found online.

[ImageID=6547471] [ImageID=6644116] [b]Edition: [/b] Korean 2021 Edition [b]Condition: [/b] NIS [b]$25[/b]
[b]Sold to Nightmaren[/b]
Rare edition only found in Korea. Comes with English Rule. I am surprised how good this ladder climbing game is. Really fun and plays up to 12 players. Comes with +100 cards that can be used to play other games like Linko.

item.body: Only played a few times. Everything in excellent condition except for the description below: If you have played the game you would know that the box is used as the shield between the two teams during the game. And when you flatten the box to do that, it would result in a crack on the inner fold of the box, please GM me if you're not sure what I'm talking about and I'm happy to show pictures. The game also came with errata stickers and those have all been applied to the correct places. $35

Played once. Has nice assembled wooden insert from laserox (https://laserox.net/photosynthesis-insert, purchased for €25+shipping) All trees were meticulously glued so that they don't fall apart while lifting them $35

Includes base game and several expansions, all in the base game box. Fog of Love Fog of Love: It Will Never Last Fog of Love: Paranormal Romance Fog of Love: Trouble with the In-Laws Game box has some minor shelf wear (GM for pictures if you'd like), but contents are all in great condition.
[-]$25[/-] sold
item.comment: Would you take $20 for it?

Original base and expansion [u]boxes[/u] are not available. Everything is already in the big box.
This is the Corporate CEO pledge level for the Big Box w/ 3D Tiles edition. It also includes [b]every[/b] add-on from the pledge manager.
Corporate CEO Pledge Level includes: - Base Game - Prelude expansion - Hellas & Elysium expansion - Venus Next expansion - Colonies expansion - Turmoil expansion - 87 3D tiles - 5 3D markers - Great Dam, Deimos Down & Magnetic Field Generator tiles - Big Box with organizer, deck boxes and card wedges - Big Box Promo Pack (17 promo cards)
Add-ons: - 500 custom card sleeves (different printings each card type) - 25 clear plastic city dome covers - Rover mini (first player marker) - Trade fleet minis (8 ships & 1 chairman seat) - 200 metal resource cubes - 5 dual-layered player boards - Turmoil KS promo pack (20 promo cards)
Extras outside of KS/Add-ons: - BGG user-created corporation pack (3 promo cards) - Penguins promo card - Self replicating robots promo card - Small asteroid promo card - Snow algae promo cards

item.comment:
Looks like a nice heirloom set for a Scrabble enthusiast. I'm not in the market for this, but I like seeing sets like this for classic games.
If it doesn't sell here, I'm sure you could sell it via eBay or look for a local Scrabble club. A surprising number of them exist around the world.

Thanks - some good suggestions I just got them in the last month - not in the biggest rush to get them. Worst case I will try to sell them again near Christmas locally they are more niche but they might gain more interest around that time. Take care.
Not sure whether you’ve seen it yet, but I PM’d you an offer a few hours ago.

item.objectname: Dungeon Bowl: The Game of Subterranean Blood Bowl Mayhem
item.body: [-]$135[/-] $125 New in Shrink Available Wed-Sat at the Con

Hi-Oooooh! Bye bye Covid. Hello Board gaming! Real Board games! No more of those failed Zoom play by internets, sims, apps or smoke signals. We’re coming back, BABY!!!
So, you better get ready and beef up your collection. I’ve got a plethora of games for sale and they gotta go!!! I’m selling at very reasonable prices and I’m open to negotiating, but please just make your offers genuine and (again) reasonable! Key word: [b]Reasonable[/b], just in case you missed it, otherwise you’re gonna get the old W.C. Fields “Scram kid. You bother me.”
I’m open to very VERY few and very specific trades, but really I just need to sell these games! I’m also willing to give you a discount on buying bundles and repeat customers.
All of these are from a smoke free, nerd hovel and have been loved and babied all their lives. Many are sleeved and some even have inserts. Many of these have also only been played once or not at all!
Not everything on the list is pictured, because I have kept adding to the list and I’m incredibly lazy, but I assure you, if it’s on the list, it’s still available!
Please PM me for any inquiries, but I suggest you go on BGG if you have any questions that are game specific.
These are auction/not so firm a price/highest bid/Just shut up give me the money! No real rules. AKA a real no holds barred event! So, step right up and make me an offer and keep in mind that it ain’t over till the fat lazy bastard (aka me) loads up the car on Tuesday night before the con at 6PM sharp.
Speaking of loading the car, as I mentioned, I’m incredibly lazy. So, if you’re in LA and [b]you want to pick some of these up in Torrance[/b] I can give you a small discount depending on what game(s) you want to buy.
Now, without further ado I give you The LIST:
Chronicle X (KS W/ all expansions (expan. sealed)) $125 Machi Koro Bright Lights Big City (opened unpunched) $30 Lisboa $130 Downfall (KS/ Deluxified) $65 Charter Stone (partially played) $25 Ethnos $25 Meeple Circus $45 Planet Steam (German Ed.) $10 Escape Plan (KS) $110 Shark Mania $15 When I Dream $25 [-]Secrets $10[/-] Fallen Angel $30 Il Principe $5 The King’s Abbey (KS) $30 Forbidden Sky $12 Trains $25 Sorcerer City $30 Asking for Troblis (2nd Ed.) $40 Queens Architect $25 Discover (open box but sealed components) $15 Otys $20 Claustrophobia (1st Ed. W/ all Expansions. IMHO better MUCH better than the 2nd) $125 Victorian Masterminds $35 7 Wonders (sealed) $45 Zombie Dice (w/ expansions) $10 Battle Goats (KS) $10 One Night Alien (KS) $10 Exploding Kittens (KS NSFW) $10 Strife (KS) $10 [-]Spirits of the Forest (Deluxe KS) $25[/-] Skulk Hollow (KS) $60 Siege Storm (KS) $50 Coin Quest (sealed) $5 [-]Mesopotamia (sealed) $10[/-] Last Defense $15 Clinic (KS w/ expansions) $75 Godspeed (KS Deluxe Ed.(beautiful game)) $90 [-]City of Gears (KS) $45[/-] Blackout: Hong Kong $30 Exit Forbidden Castle $10 Cranium: Zigity $5 Mint Works (KS) $25 Raxxon ( 2 copies) $10 each Tides of Infamy (KS) $25 King Me (sealed) $10 Moonshiners of the Apocalypse $(KS) 45 Trekking the World (KS) $45 Thug Life (KS) $15 [-]Dungeon Busters (KS) $5[/-] Struggle For Catan $8 The Ricks Must be Crazy $12 Paper Tales $30 [-]Thief’s Market (KS) $5[/-] [-]Qwixx $5[/-] [-]Cock and Bull $10[/-] Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest $55 Smash Up: It’s Your Fault (sealed) $15 House of Borgia (KS) $20 Grifters (KS) $15 The Golden Girls: Any Way You Slice It $5 Attila $15 Junta: Las Cartas $15 [-]Pillars of the Earth Builder’s Duel $5[/-] [-]New Bedford (KS) $25[/-] Arkhanos (KS w/ play mat) $45 Costa Rauna $10 Throw Throw Burrito (KS) 2 Copies $12 each The Last Banquet $20 [-]Colosseum (KS Deluxified) $65[/-] Island of El Dorado (KS) $45 In Too Deep (Deluxe KS Pledge) $80 Raccoon Tycoon (Deluxe Big Box KS with Everything) $80 [-]Gizmos $35[/-] Rising For the Throne (KS Deluxe- Why has nobody heard of this game? It’s so good!) $60 Sabotage $60 Pandemic Hot Zone (Sealed) $15 Builders of Blankenburg $25 [-]Tiny Epic Dinosaurs (KS) $25[/-] Dungeon Mayhem $10 [-]Timeline: Historical Events $12[/-] Overseers (KS) $20 Skip Bo $5 Mille Bornes $5 Unbroken (KS) $35 [-]Clashfighter (Sealed) $10[/-] Dominant Species (w/plastic insert) $90 Quantum $90 Luchador (The version with the little wrestling mat and the figures; So Cool!) $20 Grim Masquerade (with promo pin) $25 Taverns of Tiefenthal $80 Horrified (the first version) $25 The Pursuit of Happiness $30 Tumble Town (KS) $25 Broom Service $50 Herospace Marvel (box a little dinged up and missing a couple of damage markers, but otherwise this thing is sweet. I don’t even want to sell it. But I got to.) $120 The Batman Game (1989) $20 Azul (missing first player tile) $30
There has to be something you want on that list. Don’t shake your head and tell me no. That’s BS and you know it. Go back and check it again. You missed something. I know you did. You know you did. Now go back check it twice and make an offer. Go on. Don’t be a cheap skate. Make me an offer. You’d be surprised at what I’d be willing to take to get some of these games out of here.
BTW if you think this is funny you should meet me in meat space. If you see a handsome, well groomed, middle aged stud wandering around looking like he owns the joint, it’s probably me “The V”. So, come up and say wassup to your boy and let’s play a game!! See you in Vegas, Baby!!!
List updated 02/25/22. Come on! There’s still plenty out there. Dig in and look hard. There’s something in there for you. I just know there is!!! List updated again 02/26/22 You’re running out of time! Come on! Get in there and pick out a game and make is a reasonable offer! You can do it! I believe in you.
Update 9:00AM 2/28 The car will be loaded up tomorrow morning at this time. So, make your last minute purchases cuz this is winding down for me. I’ll see you all at the con. V.

$20 and you’ve got yourself a deal …

You drive a hard bargain, and I’m a sucker for more shelf space! You got it. See you there!
You people see how easy it is???? Reasonable offer meets not so desperate seller… *POP* voila! A deal is born! There’s still time to get in on this. Dig into that list again! There’s something in there for you. Yes you! Yeah, no, really. You! The person reading this. Stop reading and go look through the list and make me a deal. Go on. It’s okay. I’ll still be here. I'm looking for about $350, but I'm willing to consider serious offers.
Complete Eternal Pledge+ Kickstarter for [i]Ankh: Gods of Egypt[/i]. Also includes the playmat and art book.
Everything except for the play mat is NIS (New in shrink), and the play mat has been used twice and is in like-new condition.
I really enjoy the game, but my best friend has a complete set as well, and since he's the only one I ever play it with, I decided I don't need my own set.
Includes the following: - Base game - Tomb of Wonders (Kickstarter exclusive upgraded pieces) - Pantheon expansion - Pharaoh expansion - Guardians Set - Divine Offerings - Pharaoh Extras: Sphinxes (Kickstarter exclusive upgraded pieces) - Pantheon Extras (Kickstarter exclusive upgraded pieces) - Double-sided playmat (base game on one side, Pharaoh expansion on the other) - [i]The Art of Ankh: Gods of Egypt[/i] art book

Sorry for not being clear! I would like just the playmat
Got it. I'm not really interested in splitting it out just yet, but if, in a few days, I haven't sold the full set, I may be willing to consider it.

Age of Ultron - 20 OBO over 200 cards and over 100 dice

Starcadia Quest full kickstarter set. Includes everything from the kickstarter with all the optional buys included too. Never played and most things never opened. Just opened a few boxes to look at the minis. Asking 400 or best offer.
item.comment: I'll offer $260
Could you do 300?
I really just want the base game. How about $260 and a partial trade for something I have in my trades?

If you’re ok splitting(seeing that andres wants the base) I’d be interested in the kickstarter extras. I have the base, arrrmada, build a robot, showdown and would be happy to pick everything else up. If that sounds good Let me know! If you can list what exactly you have I can place an offer/feel free to price it.

Hey Karim that sounds good. Andres would you want the base, arrrmada, build a robot, and show down since Karim already has those? Karim the extra stuff I have is Zenith Invasion, Thorne Troopers, companion pack, scenary pack, Patty & Sherry, Nayomi & Tanaka, Brandalyn & Jakob, Curi & Yuri, Plastic Token Pack, Wound token pack, I believe I have the crew dice bundle dice for each player. Would have to check for sure though when I am back home later today. For price I thought about it and am just trying to get space for other games. Would you both want to do 130 each for the split?
Do you also have space marauders, build a robot extras, and needles? If so Im happy to do the $130.

BIN $130 for Core box with Kickstarter heroes/Monsters, space oddities Box + [thing=260117][/thing] [thing=260251][/thing] [thing=306012][/thing] [thing=260196][/thing]
If that sounds good to everyone...
[b]Thanks Trapper![/b]

Sorry @Andres I would only be able to either a/get all the kickstarter stuff or b/ none of it. It will be really hard to get some of the kickstarter stuff later (as its unlikely people will split the kickstarter extras if they have them all)
so what you would get would be: 1/ Base box 2/ Arrrmada 3/ Build a robot 4/ Showdown
I would purchase:
1/Zenith Invasion 2/Thorne Troopers 3/ Build a robot companion pack 4/scenary pack 5/Patty & Sherry 6/Nayomi & Tanak 7/Brandalyn & Jakob 8/Curi & Yuri 9/Plastic Token Pack 10/Wound token pack 11(TBC)/crew dice bundle 12(TBC)/space marauders 13(TBC)/build a robot extras 14(TBC)/needles
TBC = To be confirmed. Waiting to see if Trapper has them.

In that case I'll go back to my original offer
[b]$260[/b] for Starcadia Quest full kickstarter set
I can throw in a FREE copy of [thing=331648][/thing] + Comic Book for anyone that buys it for $300.

Sure, why not :D
[b]BIN $300[/b]
Crew dice bundle I have, build a robot I have, and Needles I have, and space marauders is also there.
So Andrew are we good with everything for 300 then?

As long as you're not splitting anything and all the stuff mentioned above is included I'm in. Thanks!
BIN $300
Sounds good to me. What day would you like to meet up?
Default time and place works for me. I'm open to any ideas you have too
As promised, I will be throwing in the FREE copy of [thing=331648][/thing] + Comic Book for you. I will have it available at the meetup. =)
Works for me if you want it early just let me know.
I'm here holding up the wall along the entrance.

item.comment: I bought Yedo from you. Would I need/want these?

No, the UnPleasant surprise kickstarter variant comes with the correct cards. The additional fixed cards were part of the addon that came with some extra modules and were not listed separately. (this was designed as an easy way for original deluxe set owners to get the new modules and fixed cards all in one. For whoever backed the whole game ended up with an extra set of fixed cards).

Hi there!
I was backer #3190 from the Deluxe Master KS campaign, didn’t know these cards had been made available. If they haven’t yet been provided to someone else, could I get them please?
Either way, nice of you to make these available.
I will be at DTW Friday afternoon and much of Saturday and Sunday.
Thanks!
Sure thing. You can have them.
Fantastic, thank you. I'll shoot you a GeekMail with my contact info so we can meet up.
